column4: i just installed ubuntu, after that i installed nividia drivers with EnvyNG. but there was a box in hardware drivers that were saying something about my drivers wwhich i clicked and installed. now the thing is i am stuck with 640x480 resolution. i tried installing nvidia drivers with EnvyNG but still. i am stuck with this resolution
are you sure your nvidia drivers are running ? sounds to me you are in vesa mode
and when you run it ?
when you go to screen 0 does it detect your card properly ?
under the GPU part
ok go under system administration, system log
and select X.org.log
there will be a lot there, first scan for any eroors
if there is an error its starts with Error: or Err:  or something like that
there are no errors
ok then go to section that starts with (II)NVIDIA  ...   or something similar
can you copy paste thet section down tyo some pasty service ?
or just copy paste everything
go to pastey.net  or similar
no, i'll check it out now
try running sudo dpkg-reconfigure -phigh xserver-xorg
now type less /etc/X11/xorg.conf
and paste everything below Section "Monitor"
ok will take a look
umm can i get back in 15 mins. i have to go for lunch :/
sorry i had to go :/ i had the display driver problem if you recall
